page.title: 10The Village of High Street
page.content: The village of High Street is about two & a half miles from St. Austell. Approximately 120 people live there. The main Newquay Road runs through the village and small cottages and bungalows are clustered together on either side. China Clay and Dairy Farming are the main sources of work for the local inhabitants. Grassed over clay tips loom over the village, resulting in the name "mini-Austria" being applied to it. A small farm shop has opened there recently and there is a large electrical shop combined with a kitchen suppliers in the village. The residents share the new Village Hall at Lanjeth but they have their own United Methodist Chapel (1883). A branch railway line runs parallel to High Street as part of the link from Burngullow to Nanpean. It is only used today for Clay transport.(Avis Martin)
